intro: Chaetogastra herincquiana, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its velvety, hairy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers are usually violet or purple in color, with five petals and a distinctive corona. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers bright, indirect light for optimal growth.
